description: Enterprise techniques used by Samurai, ATT&CK software S1099 (v1.0)
name: Samurai (S1099)

techniques.comment: [Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can use a .NET HTTPListener class to receive and handle HTTP POST requests.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can use a remote command module for execution via the Windows command line.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)

[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can create a service at `HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\SvcHost` to trigger execution and maintain persistence.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can base64 encode data sent in C2 communications prior to its encryption.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can leverage an exfiltration module to download arbitrary files from compromised machines.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can encrypt C2 communications with AES.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can use a specific module for file enumeration.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) has been used to deploy other malware including [Ninja](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1100).(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)

[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) has created the directory `%COMMONPROGRAMFILES%\Microsoft Shared\wmi\` to contain DLLs for loading successive stages.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)

The [Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) loader component can create multiple Registry keys to force the svchost.exe process to load the final backdoor.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) has the ability to call Windows APIs.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can use a proxy module to forward TCP packets to external hosts.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can encrypt the names of requested APIs.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can compile and execute downloaded modules at runtime.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can encrypt API name strings with an XOR-based algorithm.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can deliver its final payload as a compressed, encrypted and base64-encoded blob.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) has the ability to proxy connections to specified remote IPs and ports through a a proxy module.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can query `SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework\policy\v2.0` for discovery.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
[Samurai](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1099) can check for the presence and version of the .NET framework.(Citation: Kaspersky ToddyCat June 2022)
